titleStmt.title: By the King and Queen, a proclamation. Marie R. The King and Queens Most Excellent Majesties taking into their princely consideration, that the holding the next Assizes for the several counties of this kingdom at the days and times first intended, might greatly obstruct the good endeavours ... for the common defence of the kingdom at this time of invasion by the French ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1689-1694 : William and Mary)
William III, King of England, 1650-1702.
Mary II, Queen of England, 1662-1694.

publicationStmt.publisher: by the Heir of Andrew Anderson, Printer to the King and Queens Most Excellent Majesties,

notesStmt.note: Title from caption and first lines of text.
Dated: Given at Our Court at Whitehall the nineteenth day of July, 1690. In the second year of Our Reign.
Reproduction of the original in the National Library of Scotland.
